description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the remote code execution vulnerability due to the heap-based buffer overflow in Windows Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS), apply the patch KB5039211 or KB5039212. This will ensure that any potential exploit is mitigated.

1. Download the appropriate update package for your Windows version from the links below.
2. Install the update by following the on-screen instructions.
3. Restart your system to apply the changes.

**Details**:
- For Windows 10 Version 22H2 and 21H2, ensure you install KB5039211. For the corresponding versions in Windows 11, KB5039212 is required.
- For versions 21H2 and 23H2 of Windows 11, also ensure KB5039213 is applied.
- Links to update packages are provided for your convenience.

**Preconditions**:
- Validate that your system is compatible with the update based on your current build number.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation.

**Update Packages**:
- [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
- [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
- [KB5039213](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039213)
- [KB5039225](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039225)

This patch addresses existing vulnerabilities enabling remote code execution capabilities in the RRAS.
